page.title: 03COUNTRY LIFE - THE LAND
page.content: The twelve grid sqares allocated for this project are almost totally used for farming.The land is generally flat or undulating with small areas of woodland and copse between the fields of crops.The woodlands contain a mixture of trees but are mainly deciduous with a variety of plants and wildlife.The woods are private and may contain wild fowl. The farms are large and concentrate on arable farming.The fields are varied in size but mostly large.The main crops grown are wheat and barley. This gives the landscape a beautiful view of rolling green fields in the Spring with the skyline broken up by the woodlands. There are few roads in this area most of which are narrow country lanes running through the farmlands.
